meanings.sent1: The little boy's face was smutchy after playing in the mud.
meanings.sent2: The old book had a smutchy cover from years of use.
meanings.sent3: She tried to clean her smutchy hands with a wet wipe.
meanings.sent4: The smutchy windows made it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent5: The smutchy puppy left paw prints all over the floor.

meanings.definition: To make something dirty or smudged.
meanings.sent1: Please don't smutchy the clean mirror with your fingerprints.
meanings.sent2: The painter accidentally smutchyed the wall with paint.
meanings.sent3: He always manages to smutchy his shirt while eating spaghetti.
meanings.sent4: The rain smutchyed the freshly painted fence.
meanings.sent5: She didn't mean to smutchy the glass, but her hands were dirty.

meanings.sent1: There was a smutchy on the paper where the ink had smudged.
meanings.sent2: She tried to wipe off the smutchy on her glasses.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly showed off the smutchy on her cheek from painting.
meanings.sent4: The artist added a smutchy to the painting to give it character.
meanings.sent5: The detective found a smutchy on the window, indicating foul play.
